intro: Schefflera rhododendrifolia, commonly known as the red-leaf schefflera, is a unique plant characterized by its striking foliage. It features large, palmate leaves that are typically a vibrant red or purple, especially when grown in cooler conditions. The plant belongs to the Araliaceae family and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Its foliage changes with the seasons, making it an attractive ornamental plant. It prefers partial shade and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor or shaded garden environments.
